content: simple spiral socks designed by belinda glynn the simple spiral socks are top-down socks with a slip-stitch heel and gusset that feature a fun and easy lace pattern that spirals around the sock to create a visually interesting design and a comfortable and stretchy fabric simple spiral socks finished size 17 5 20 22 5 cm / 7 7 75 8 75 inches foot circumference sizing note the lace pattern creates a fabric that is stretchier than stockinette so the cuff will be slightly looser than the foot please take that into account when selecting the size particularly if you prefer socks with a lot of negative ease yarn 100g 4ply/fingering weight yarn example shown is wren & ollie sock in praline needles 2 25mm us 1 60 cm 24 inch circular needle or preferred sock-knitting needle notions tapestry needle stitch marker optional gauge 8 stitches x 11 5 row over 2 5cm 1 inch in stockinette abbreviations bor beginning of round k knit p purl sl1 slip 1 purlwise with yarn held in back ssk slip 2 stitches knitwise knit these two stitches together through the back loop k2tog knit 2 stitches together p2tog purl 2 stitches together yo yarn over simple spiral socks | @hereiknitdesigns | hereiknit@gmail com | page 1 simple spiral socks cuff and leg cast on 56 64 72 stitches using a stretchy cast-on such as the german twisted cast-on join being careful not to twist note this sock is written to be knitted using magic loop and therefore does not need a stitch marker to mark the bor however if using another method to knit the socks that does require a bor marker add a stitch marker here ribbing round *k2 p2* repeat to end of round repeat ribbing round 9 14 19 times there will be 10 15 20 ribbing rounds in total knit 1 round start chart a note at the end of round 14 of chart a only the beginning of round moves one stitch to the left this is done by knitting the first stitch of round 1 and sliding it onto the previous needle if using a stitch marker to mark the bor remove the marker knit the stitch and then place the marker what was the second stitch of the round is now the first stitch knit leg for 10 15 20 cm/4 6 8 inches from the cast-on edge or desired leg length finishing on an odd row heel these heel directions have been written for magic loop with 28 32 36 stitches on each needle needle 1 contains the stitches for the top of the foot while needle 2 contains the heel and foot stitches heel flap heel flap set-up row knit the 28 32 36 stitches on needle 1 in the pattern as set on the leg on needle 2 *sl1 k1* repeat 13 15 17 times
